c74object.name: cage.weightbuilder
c74object.description: Builds probability weights for an incoming llll depending on specified density function and parameters.

objarg.name: probability_function_and_params
objarg.description: The optional arguments sets the initial probability density function and parameters (see list message).

method.name: bang
method.description: Output the result obtained from the most recently received input data.

method.name: list
method.description:
A list in the second inlet contains the name of the probability density function to be used, and all the needed parameters for such function. The syntax is thus: function_name optional:parameter_1 optional:parameter_2... Function names are one of the following symbols: uniform, gaussian, lognormal pareto, custom.
- uniform: needs no arguments, and create uniform probability weights (each note has the same probability)
- gaussian: needs two arguments: the mean (mu) and the standard deviation (sigma).
- lognormal: needs two arguments: the mean (mu) and the standard deviation (sigma).
- pareto: needs two arguments: the pareto wall (in midicents) and the exponent.
- custom: needs as argument an interleaved plain list of X Y points of a breakpoint function representing the density function.

method.name: llll
method.digest: Set pitches or density function and parameters, output result
method.description:
An llll in the first inlet contains the pitches for which probability weights must be built. Such weights are built and output.
An llll in the second inlet contains the name of the probability density function to be used, and all the needed parameters for such function. See list to know more.

attribute.name: out
attribute.description:
The out attribute is a sequence of characters identifying the outlet types (one character for each llll outlet). Characters can be one of the followings:
n (default): 'native' output: faster and more precise between bach objects, but unreadable by standard Max objects (an "bach.llll" message appears instead).
t: 'text' output: slower and limited in size, but readable by standard Max objects. A plain llll in text format is a generic Max message.
x: disabled output (nothing is output)
p: 'portal' output: only used by bach.portal to intercept the @out attribute specified while creating the abstraction (see bach.portal).
The native output is recommended, unless communication with standard Max messages is needed. Disabling unused outputs can be useful if extreme optimization of the patch is needed.

c74object.discussion: Supported probability density functions are: uniform, gaussian, lognormal, pareto. Custom distributions can also be defined, via breakpoint functions.
